i suspect its some malformed response from your server that for some reason bothers the rest-client... but from your http response its impossible to say,

so please add to your classpath the log4j.jar and log4j.jxml file bundled in the rest fixture.
you can find them also here 

https://github.com/smartrics/RestFixture/blob/master/src/main/resources/log4j.xml
https://github.com/smartrics/RestFixture/tree/master/lib/log4j

in the xml file replace WARN with DEBUG for the httpclient.wire categrory.

then

!path C:\BuildTools\Fitnesse\RestFixture-2.0.beta.2\lib\log4j.xml
!path C:\BuildTools\Fitnesse\RestFixture-2.0.beta.2\lib\log4j-1.2.14.jar

rerun your tests and please send the output

Am pretty sure this happens for me too.! I figured out the cause of this issue. When you don't verify for  response this happens. For example in the above scenario he only checks for 200 response , so this exception rises. The same when u check response body the exception is not showing. :)
Confirmed that this solved our problem as well. Thanks elbulldozer

Hi - for your info, I have now fixed the rest fixture to supply a non null message... hopefully next time it'll be clearer.
the fix is currently committed on master. It'll get in as soon as I build the new downloadable artefacts
cheers
Thanks a lot for the fix :) .. Actually i fixed it myself and was using it for quite sometime :)

issue.title: Enhancement to "ignore timeouts"

repository.name: RestFixture
repository.description: A FitNesse fixture for testing REST services

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
We wanted to write some functional tests that verify the behavior of our API in the face of concurrent  requests to update the same resource.

In our implementation we lock the resource such that other GET/POST/PUT requests will fail with a 409 because the resource is locked.

To test that this locking is behaving correctly we thought of this sort of RestFixture scenario...

The key is that we need to have Fitnesse issue two REST calls "concurrently".  So we simulate "concurrently" in the following way...

1) make a POST to change the state of resource X
       a. using a configuration with http.client.connection.timeout=500ms
       b. we use some hidden behavior in our resource implementation that causes this request
           to take a few seconds
       c. we would expect this RestFixture row to timeout... but we don't want this to be counted
           as an error or an exception
       d. this row doesn't check the response code or the response body (since we expect it to timeout)
2) make another POST to resource X
      a. the test expects this to get an 409 (because the resource is locked)
3) wait a few seconds
4) make a GET request to see that the initial POST actually completed its work as expected

To enable this kind of test, the enhancement in this commit is three-fold:

1) add a new configuration parameter:

```
  restfixture.ignore.read.timeout     (boolean true | false)
```

2) make the code in the RestFixture.doMethod() be aware of this flag and if we see a timeout then ignore it

3) add a sleep() method so that we can easily do a sleep in our test (step #3 above).
# 

I'm afraid that this commit also includes a couple of other things that you don't want.
1) change to the pom file so that I could get the fixture to build
2) make the RestFixture extend fit.Fixture
    I couldn't get the fixture to work in Fitnesse without that.  There's probably something I'm doing 
    incorrectly
3) changes to comment out the setHeader substitution because Fitnesse was counting those as
    "wrong assertions"
# 

I'm sure that my hack to make the code ignore timeouts could be done more elegantly... so if you see a better way to do it please feel free to fix it.

I'm afraid I didn't write any unit tests for this functionality.  I'm not sure how I would test that kind of timeout handling in junit.

I'm happy to discuss this enhancement it you want to understand our motivation.

issue.title: Can I use RestFixture to test if a web server is down?

repository.name: RestFixture
repository.description: A FitNesse fixture for testing REST services

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
I'm trying to write a simple test to see whether the rest server is down using RestFixture before sending a restful request.  If the response code is NOT 200, then I know it's down and no need to send a request.

I keep getting this error:
INFO: I/O exception (java.net.ConnectException) caught when processing request: Connection timed out: connect
OR
Execution of GET caused exception 'Http call failed for IO failure'

Can someone help?  

!define TEST_SYSTEM {slim}
!path C:\QATests\RestFixtureLib\lib\*.jar
!path C:\QATests\fitnesse-standalone.jar

|Import|
|smartrics.rest.fitnesse.fixture|

|Table: Rest Fixture|http://localhost:8888|
|GET||200|||
